page.title: 14Tourism-Important Buildings.
page.content: Situated a few hundred yards down the Esplanade,is the famous Victorian Town Hall completed in 1871;a legacy of Rochdale's former position as one of the nation's most important textile-producing centres. The interior is particularly remarkable because of the magnificent Great Hall reached by a fine Gothic-Revival staircase,with stained-glass windows quoted as being the finest modern examples of their kind. St.Chad's Parish Church has Saxon origins and the earliest written records date back to 1194.Two famous Rochdalians are buried in the churchyard:Tim Bobbin,a local dialect poet,and Hamlet Nicholson,who invented the cricket ball.
